speaker: SCULLY'S VOICE OVER
line: It begins where it ends... In nothingness. A nightmare born from deepest fears, coming to me unguarded. Whispering images unlocked from time and distance. A soul unbound - touched by others but never held. On a course charted by some unseen hand. The journey ahead promising no more than my past reflecting back upon me. Until at last, I reach the end. Facing a truth I can no longer deny. Alone, as ever.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, I'm looking for the special needs ward.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Second door over there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Emily? I'd like you to meet a friend of mine. His name is Mulder. Remember, I told you about him?

speaker: EMILY
line: Uh hum.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's a little shy.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you coloring?

speaker: EMILY
line: A potato.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you ever seen Mr. Potato head? He looks like this. Doesn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll be right back. Thank you for coming. Something's wrong, isn't it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I found Emily's surrogate mother. I had Frohike hack into the California Social Services Adoption database.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got a name?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, her mother of record is one Anna Fugazzi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Fugazzi?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, as in slang term for fake.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand. Why create a false record?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because there are no true records. Emily didn't come into this world through any system that keeps them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did she come into this world?

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you asked yourself that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, she was born to someone, she... she has to belong to someone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Someone, who's proven that they'll do anything to protect her or their interest in her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can protect her too.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but who's going to protect you? Emily's adoptive parents are both dead, by no accident.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know... I've considered that, but I've also considered that there's only one right thing to do.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Emily?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why didn't you call me sooner?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because I couldn't believe it. But I need you now to be a witness on my behalf in this hearing.

speaker: MULDER
line: And I should have declined... if I never want to see you hurt or harmed in any way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why are you here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because I know something that I haven't said... Something that they'll use against you to jeopardize your custody of Emily. No matter how much you love this little girl, she's a miracle that was never meant to be, Scully.

speaker: BILL
line: They're ready for you.

speaker: MAN
line: Agent Mulder, help me out here. Does FBI stand for Federal Bureau of Imagination? Am I to understand that your partner along with a dozen other woman in Allentown, PA, was abducted by employees of our federal government?

speaker: MULDER
line: She was missing for 4 weeks, that's documented in the file.

speaker: MAN
line: And you found evidence that during this time, she was subjected to experiments where... you say, they extracted her ova?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, all of them.

speaker: MAN
line: Can this be done?

speaker: MULDER
line: I believe it can, and was. That Emily Sim was conceived as a result of those experiments.

speaker: MAN
line: Can that be done as well?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know how else to explain it. A medical exam of Ms. Scully would show that she hasn't given birth.

speaker: MAN
line: You know, under normal circumstances, this petition would be fairly simple. But I'm having difficulty wrapping my brain around this Michael Crichton bit.

speaker: MULDER
line: I included this information in anticipation of your reaction and how it might look if you received this information without any explanation.

speaker: MAN
line: Can you give me an explanation? Why anyone would kidnap Ms. Scully, to conceive this child, then put it up for adoption?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, but the fact remains, Ms. Scully is the mother of this child.

speaker: MAN
line: Not in any legal definition.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if you can show me a legal precedent for this case, I'd like to see it. Dana has known for quite some time that she can't bear children. She doesn't know why, but however that happened, that fact that she can adopt this child, her own flesh and blood, is something I don't feel I have the right to question and I don't believe anyone has the right to stand in the way of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It takes two of us just to get my sister-in-law into bed these days.

speaker: MULDER
line: When's she due?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Two weeks ago. Why didn't you tell me, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I never expected this. I thought I was protecting you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would they do this to me?

speaker: MULDER
line: I only know that genetic experiments were being done, that children were being created.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Children being created for who?

speaker: MULDER
line: For who? For what? I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello? Hello? Hello, is anybody there?

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to trace a call. I have an incoming call to residential line 555-0380.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's...

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't hang up. Okay, thanks. I got a trace. County Children's Center.

speaker: WOMAN
line: What is it? What's the matter?

speaker: MULDER
line: Anyone been here the last half hour?

speaker: WOMAN
line: No. What's going on?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's burning up.

speaker: WOMAN
line: I'll call 911.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully? There's something on her neck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I'll try back later. I spoke to the social worker. She hasn't been able to reach Emily's doctor.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is she?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Well, we've put her on a saline drip to rehydrate her. She's running a fever of about 102. It's a good thing you got her here when you did.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know what's causing it?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Some kind of infection, probably related to the cyst on her neck.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know what that is?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: No. I'm having it byopsied. I'll get it off to the lab right away. Now, are you two the parents?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm her mother.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Oh, okay. Can you give me any history that might help?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know that she was being treated for anemia.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: You know what type?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was told that it was some kind of auto immune hemolytic anemia. Her treatment was experimental.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Who's her doctor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: His name is Calderon.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I don't know him.

speaker: FEMALE DOCTOR
line: I'm just going to roll you onto your side, Sweetie.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait! Stop! Move away from her! Get away from her!

speaker: MULDER
line: She still sleeping?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They have her under a mild sedative.

speaker: MULDER
line: The ER doctor is in and out of consciousness.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: If Emily was someone's creation, then it occurred to me that she might share the same body chemistry that we've seen before. So I had them put the ER doctor in a cooling bath like you did when I was exposed to this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what now? She's still just a little girl. You say I can't protect her, but I can't let this be her life. Just a few days ago she was fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: She was also being treated.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Um, I just need some advice. With everything that's happening here, I'm a little at sea. This Dr. Calderon you say is Emily's physician? He's refusing to transfer her medical records.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He can't do that. He's endangering her life.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: He said Emily was in his care, and if you're the one who's stopping that, then you're the one endangering her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's an ethical violation .

speaker: DOCTOR
line: He said she was part of a double blind medical trial and that he's spoken to you about it. He also says you have no authority over this child.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, authority or not, I'm not leaving her side.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: It's beyond me, I'm afraid.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but it's not beyond Dr. Calderon.

speaker: CALDERON
line: I'd like to say right up front that I know Emily Sim as your partner probably told you. My god, I... never met a sweeter, courageous little girl. I'm so sorry to hear about her down turn. My hope is these custody matters can be resolved so she may resume her treatment here. I'm afraid I can't release any information that relates to our companies experimental drug trials.

speaker: MULDER
line: What can I say to convince you?

speaker: CALDERON
line: It's really not about convincing me. This is something that I- well, we... simply cannot do. It's purely a business reality. It has to do with Transgen's exposure to litigation and of course, our need to protect our research which frankly, represents a significant dollar investment.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, I'm wasting your time. This isn't worth the life of a three year old girl.

speaker: CALDERON
line: I wouldn't frame it like that. That's not it at all. Look, I'm truly sorry but there's really nothing I can do. However, I do wish you the very best.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay then. How do you feel now? Why don't you tell me what your company's really in the business of. Huh? Abducting women and stealing their unborn children? Medical rapists! That's all you are! You don't care if that little girl dies! She's just a lab rat to you! Tell me, whose life is worth saving, yours or hers? I want everything to help that little girl! I'll be back.

speaker: NURSE
line: We're ready.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you give me a minute with her? Hey... Sweetie? In a minute a nurse is going to take you down to have some tests.

speaker: EMILY
line: Mommy said no more tests.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We just want you to get better. That's what these tests are for.

speaker: CALDERON
line: He came to see me. He knows I'm involved.

speaker: MAN
line: Now you brought him to see us.

speaker: CALDERON
line: What do you want me to tell him?

speaker: MAN
line: Nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I hope you know what this is.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: An autoplastic mass, tumorous infection... The cyst on the back of Emily's neck seems to be the point of origin. And from her blood test last night and early this morning, it seems to be growing rapidly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it cancer?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: No. Cancer grows out of control. These are anaerobic channels following the path of the nervous system. They have the effect of killing surrounding tissue, depriving it of the oxygen it needs to survive. The origin is in the brain and central nervous system. It couldn't be in a worst place.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you put her on antivirals?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I have her on a levophod drip to keep her blood pressure up and I've got her on steroids intravenously to bring down the inflammation. We could try radiation therapy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, you can't do that. Her immune system's too weak.

speaker: WOMAN
line: What can you do? Has anyone talked to Dr. Calderon about this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Calderon? Get Dr. Vinet in there and call the police. Dr. Calderon? Halt! Dr. Calderon! FBI! Stop that man!

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm following Dr. Calderon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean, you've been following him. I just saw him. There was a scare here. He was here, he came into Emily's room. It appears he injected her with something.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is she all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She seems to be, but we're running a tox screen anyway.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever he injected her with I don't think he meant to harm her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think Dr. Calderon went there to treat her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that doesn't make any sense. Why would he endanger her before only to protect her now?

speaker: MULDER
line: As a bluff. I don't think they want her dead either, Scully, but for different reasons. Look, I'm going to catch up with you, all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Detective.

speaker: KRESGE
line: Happy New Year.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thanks for coming down.

speaker: KRESGE
line: I'm posting two cops outside her room.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That might not be necessary.

speaker: KRESGE
line: What if this guy Calderon is thinking of coming back?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There seems to be some indication that he came here to help her.

speaker: KRESGE
line: I don't understand. You said on the phone that he was somehow connected to the deaths of Emily's parents...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because Emily's mother wanted to stop the tests, just like I did, and I guess that's why he came here because as much as they want to remove anything that gets in their way, it seems they need Emily to continue the tests.

speaker: ANNA
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Anna Fugazzi?

speaker: ANNA
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: Your name is Anna Fugazzi?

speaker: ANNA
line: Yes. Are you the new doctor?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm not. Is that your real name?

speaker: ANNA
line: Yes, for the last 71 years. Were you looking for me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not until now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand. Just an hour ago you said she was getting better.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: That's right. Her fever's down, her vital signs are nearly back to normal. But these MRIs are telling me that this growth has continued to spread. What we're now seeing seems like a necratizing of the tissue.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's killing her.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Whatever it is, it may already be present in some amount. Basically, it shut down her body while it continued to grow.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: I presented all this information to the court. I have to tell you that they are greatly concerned that you are making decisions for this child. And they seem to be having no small effect on her health.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ms. Chambliss, I am a medical doctor. And the decisions that I make are reasonable and right.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: But I have it right here in this report that Dr. Calderon's treatment of her actually resulted in a turnaround.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. That is not true. The injection that Dr. Calderon gave her is actually making her worse.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: I want to say something to you and I don't want you to take this the wrong way, but I don't think that you are capable right now of responding with any clinical ability.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you think I don't want what's best for this child? Do you think that I'm not trying to save her life?

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: I'm saying I'm getting wildly differing reports. I have a job to do. I'm not the ultimate authority here, but you don't have the authority, either over this child or her future.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You can get a court order and you can try to enforce it, but I suggest that if you're going to do what's best for this child, then you do everything in your power to tell the authorities that if they take Emily out of this hospital, they are going to hasten her illness. And I'll let it be known that all of you are responsible.

speaker: CHAMBLISS
line: What do you want me to tell them you're doing for her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know yet, but I will.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Christina Sherman. Delivered a healthy baby girl September 25, 1994. Delivered a baby boy March 18, 1986.

speaker: MULDER
line: Evelyn Burmeister.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Evelyn Burmeister... delivered a baby boy June 1, 1994.

speaker: MULDER
line: That makes 8 for 8.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Are you at Adoption Services, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: No I'm at the maternity ward.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Any fetching young mothers there?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you might have a shot here Frohike. Do you know anything about pharmaceuticals?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Medicinal or... recreational?

speaker: MULDER
line: There's two prescriptions on their med charts that all these women have in common. Abbreviated PMZ 200 and Duratab.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Estrogen and pretesterone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hormones.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: But that doesn't make any sense, Mulder. Pregnant women have those hormones in abundance. You wouldn't give those to pregnant women.

speaker: MULDER
line: You would these. Anna? There's a doctor that comes to visit you. a Dr. Calderon.

speaker: ANNA
line: Yes. Do you know where he is?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, actually, I'm looking for him.

speaker: ANNA
line: He was supposed to be here. I was going to start my beauty sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your beauty sleep. What is that?

speaker: ANNA
line: He says it's taken years off my appearance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay in there, Emily. Good. I'm going to be right here the whole time, okay? Now we're just going to put some extra air in there, so you tell me if your ears start to hurt. You okay, Sweetie? Turn it off! Turn it off, NOW!

speaker: TECH
line: I'm doing it ma'am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hold on Sweetie. Settle down. We'll get you out of there as fact as we can.

speaker: KRESGE
line: Flinch and you're dead. Hands where I can see them. What you got there? Give it to me slowly. Hands against the wall. Spread your legs.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: KRESGE
line: Detective Kresge, San Diego PD.

speaker: MULDER
line: Detective Kresge, I'm Agent Fox Mulder with the FBI. Take the gun off me and put it on that man.

speaker: KRESGE
line: Stop right there!

speaker: MULDER
line: Run. Get out of here. Don't use your gun. Get out of here!

speaker: KRESGE
line: I said stop right there!

speaker: MULDER
line: Kresge...

speaker: KRESGE
line: I said stop right there!

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't fire, Kresge!

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm an FBI agent. I have an emergency situation. I need an ambulance and I need backup.

speaker: ON PHONE
line: Where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know where I am.

speaker: KRESGE
line: I have him inside.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have your weapon.

speaker: KRESGE
line: I have him on the floor, hands cuffed.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have back up coming. I need a location though.

speaker: KRESGE
line: I'll take care of it. Just watch the guy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Detective Kresge is going to radio in the location.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's gone into a coma. I'm okay, Mulder. It's what's meant to be.

speaker: MULDER
line: But if you could treat her...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I wouldn't. I wouldn't do it to her.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you sure?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, whoever brought this child into this world... didn't intend to love her.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think she was born to... serve an agenda.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have a chance to stop that. You were right. This child... was not meant to be.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right. I'll stay with you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I'd like to be alone.

speaker: MRS. SCULLY
line: You ready?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I'll ride back with Mulder. Bye, bye Matthew.

speaker: TARA
line: We'll see you at home, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are the men who would create a life whose only hope was to die?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. But the fact that you found her... and had a chance to love her... Then maybe she was meant for that too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She found me.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you could save her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How's Detective Kresge?

speaker: MULDER
line: He's doing better. He's already out of the ICU.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And the men who did this to him?

speaker: MULDER
line: They've already cleaned up the nursing home. All the women have been placed in new homes. There's no evidence that anyone at Transgen Corporation knew of Calderon's work.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There is evidence of what they did.
